Found this during testing M6. Coudldn't reproduce it though.

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 380 2006-04-05 10:44:00.250
!MESSAGE The resource tree is locked for modifications.

This occurs when the indexer for a project isn't set during a resource change event. The PDOMManager attempts to set it to the default but the Workspace is locked and this is an illegal operation. I need to create a Job to do this after the workspace is unlocked.

Well, in the end, I'll just not set it during a getIndexerId call. If the indexerId isn't set in the project preferences, it goes to the CDescriptor and if not there, then uses the default in the workspace preferences. Since this isn't a high runner call, this should be fine.

traces.message: The resource tree is locked for modifications.
